column4: Point your browser to 127.0.0.1 and see whats running on it. If it just says: "It works!" then uninstall it, you don't need it. Otherwise you should see a page with information about what program is using the webserver.
open a fullscreen terminal and run "top" in it, disable any screensaver type stuff. Top lists the most resource hungry apps in realtime, when its frozen, the top app is probably the culprit.
Also, do this at the end of the night before bed if you didn't get the implied time frame.
